recipe.name: Soda Bread
recipe.notes: Try this easy soda bread recipe for when you want bread in a hurry â€“ it's ready in less than an hour with no kneading, proving (or yeast). This makes a small loaf, but you can easily double the recipe and make two.

ingredient_item.ingredient: plain flour, plus extra for dusting

listInstructions.instruction: Whisk together the lemon juice and soy milk.

Tip the flours, salt and bicarbonate of soda into a large bowl and stir. Make a well in the centre and pour in the milk mixture, mixing quickly with a large fork to form a soft dough. (Depending upon the absorbency of the flour, you may need to add a little milk if the dough seems too stiff but it should not be too wet or sticky.)
Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead briefly. Form into a round and flatten the dough slightly before placing on a lightly floured baking sheet.
Cut a cross on the top and bake for about 30 minutes or until the loaf sounds hollow when tapped. Cool on a wire rack.
